sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: InvestingPro’s Fair Value model predicted Webull’s 48% stock decline By Investing.com
feed.summary: InvestingPro's Fair Value model accurately predicted a 48% decline in Webull Corporation (NASDAQ:BULL) stock, identifying it as significantly overvalued in July 2025. Despite strong revenue growth, the model detected fundamental weaknesses that led to the stock plummeting from $16.05 to $8.37, validating its comprehensive valuation methodology. InvestingPro offers tools for investors to identify similar overvalued or undervalued opportunities.

feed.title: InvestingPro’s Fair Value model predicted Webull’s 48% stock decline By Investing.com
feed.summary: InvestingPro's Fair Value model accurately predicted a nearly 48% stock decline for Webull Corporation (NASDAQ:BULL) starting in late July 2025. The model flagged Webull as substantially overvalued at $16.05, suggesting a fair value of $8.78, which proved accurate as the stock now trades at $8.37. This analysis, based on multiple valuation methodologies, identified fundamental weaknesses despite strong revenue growth, highlighting the platform's ability to foresee market disconnects.

A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Webull (NASDAQ: BULL) is undervalued by 51.4%, with an intrinsic value of $17.98 per share compared to its current market price of $8.74. However, its Price to Sales ratio of 8.52x, significantly above the industry average, indicates it might be overvalued based on that metric.

feed.title: Exclusive Webull Promo: Get S$50^ voucher plus up to 3.5% p.a* daily interest bonus
feed.summary: Beansprout is offering an exclusive promotion for new Webull users in Singapore. By signing up via Beansprout, funding a minimum of S$3,000, and maintaining it for 30 days, users can receive a S$50 Fairprice voucher, additional Apple shares, and earn up to 3.5% p.a. daily interest bonus. The promotion also includes Webull's welcome rewards, offering up to S$280 in Apple shares for larger deposits.

feed.title: SnapTrade Partners With Webull
feed.summary: SnapTrade has partnered with Webull to integrate advanced trading tools and capabilities into third-party apps through Webull's API. This collaboration allows investors to view portfolios holistically and execute trades in real-time, aiming to democratize finance by providing seamless and secure trading experiences. The partnership is available in the U.S. and Canada, expanding Webull's reach and SnapTrade's brokerage services.

feed.title: SnapTrade Partners With Webull

Analysts remain cautiously optimistic, with Webull's future trajectory balancing significant potential against inherent financial risks.

feed.title: Webull Corporation (BULL) Gets a Buy from Rosenblatt Securities
feed.summary: Rosenblatt Securities reiterated a "Buy" rating for Webull Corporation (BULL) with a $15.00 price target, based on analyst Chris Brendler's assessment. The company recently reported strong Q3 2025 financial results, including significant revenue growth and a net profit.

feed.title: Webull Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Webull reported strong third-quarter 2025 financial results, with total revenues increasing 55% year-over-year to $156.9 million and customer assets growing 84% to $21.2 billion. The company achieved significant profitability, with income before income taxes totaling $38.9 million, and continued strategic investments in geographic expansion, AI, and new product offerings like corporate bonds and cryptocurrency trading. These results were driven by increased user engagement, high trading volumes, and successful product innovations such as the launch of Vega AI.

feed.title: Webull Q3 Earnings Preview: Crypto Trading Volumes In Focus After Relaunch
feed.summary: Webull's Q3 earnings preview indicates Wall Street expects $0.03 EPS on $137.5 million revenue, with particular focus on crypto trading volumes following the platform's relaunch. The company's stock has recently dipped amid broader cryptocurrency market weakness, though retail sentiment on Stocktwits remains "extremely bullish." Investors are also keen on commentary regarding new AI-driven tools and Webull's guidance, especially concerning crypto volumes, given its recent SPAC merger and stock performance.

feed.title: CQG expands trading support to third Webull APAC subsidiary
feed.summary: CQG has expanded its trading support to Webull Singapore, marking its third Webull subsidiary in the Asia-Pacific region to receive futures trading infrastructure and order routing access. This partnership follows similar integrations with Webull's Hong Kong and Malaysia subsidiaries, enabling Webull Singapore to enhance its futures offering, complementing its existing equities and options services. Despite Webull Corporation (NASDAQ:BULL) facing recent stock price pressure, the company anticipates net income growth this year and is broadening its market presence through strategic partnerships and new investment tools.

feed.title: Webull Announces Strategic Partnership with Meritz Financial Group to Broaden Access to Global Markets and Enter South Korea
feed.summary: Webull Corporation has formed a strategic partnership with Meritz Financial Group to facilitate its entry into the South Korean market. This collaboration aims to provide South Korean investors with seamless access to U.S. equity markets and Webull's trading tools, leveraging Meritz's strong customer base and Webull's technology. The partnership is a key step in Webull's global expansion strategy, enhancing financial accessibility and fostering a borderless investing experience.

feed.title: Webull to Release Third Quarter 2025 Results on November 20, 2025
feed.summary: Webull Corporation announced it will release its third quarter 2025 earnings results after market close on November 20, 2025. The company will host a conference call at 5:00 p.m. ET to discuss the results, with access available on their investor relations website. Webull, a digital investment platform, offers services in 14 markets with over 24 million registered users globally.

feed.title: BULL’s Unexpected Surge: Impacts and Outlook
feed.summary: Webull Corporation (NASDAQ: BULL) experienced a -4.85% stock decline amidst mixed investor sentiment and market volatility, despite reporting a gross profit of $101.88M in its third quarter. The company maintains over a billion dollars in cash reserves but faces challenges with a net loss of $9.57M and a negative return on equity, stirring speculation about future strategic collaborations and operational reforms. Investors are keenly watching for further disclosures on asset turnovers and potential dividend or stock split announcements.

feed.title: Webull Launches Corporate Bond Trading, Expanding its Fixed Income Investment Options - WV News
feed.summary: Webull has launched corporate bond trading on its desktop and mobile platforms, expanding its fixed income investment options with competitive transaction spreads of 0.10%. This addition follows the rollout of U.S. government bonds and fractional bond trading, aiming to provide retail investors with accessible tools for portfolio diversification, income, and capital preservation. Webull's corporate bond offerings include investment-grade and high-yield, U.S. dollar-denominated bonds rated by S&P, initially available to U.S. customers with future plans for global expansion.

feed.title: Webull HK empowers investors with full investment power and 0% fees - Marketing-Interactive
feed.summary: Webull Securities (Webull Hong Kong) has launched a new brand campaign in Hong Kong, "0% fee, 100% investment power!", to highlight its elimination of commission and platform fees for US and Hong Kong stock trading. The campaign, developed with Giraffe Hong Kong and WPP Media, aims for cost transparency and significant brand recall through AI-generated visuals and high-impact out-of-home and digital placements. Webull HK emphasizes its commitment to empowering investors with maximum power to seize market opportunities by offering the lowest costs.

feed.title: Webull Launches Corporate Bond Trading, Expanding Its Fixed Income Investment Options - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Webull has introduced corporate bond trading for its U.S. customers, significantly expanding its fixed income investment options. This new offering allows investors to buy and sell individual corporate bonds directly on Webull's platforms with competitive spreads of 0.10% ($10/trade minimum). The move follows the successful rollout of U.S. government bonds and aims to provide cost-effective access to both investment-grade and high-yield corporate bonds, all denominated in USD and S&P rated.

feed.title: Webull launches corporate bond trading for US customers - FX News Group
feed.summary: Webull has launched corporate bond trading for its U.S. customers, following its earlier rollout of U.S. government bonds. This expansion allows investors to buy and sell individual corporate bonds directly on Webull’s platforms, enhancing its fixed income offerings. The company, through its CEO Anthony Denier, emphasized that corporate bonds are crucial for diversified portfolios and aims to provide a seamless experience for investors seeking diversification, income, and capital preservation.

feed.title: Webull Launches Corporate Bond Trading, Expanding its Fixed Income Investment Options - The AI Journal
feed.summary: Webull has expanded its fixed income offerings by launching corporate bond trading, building on its previous rollout of U.S. government bonds. This new feature allows investors to trade corporate bonds on both desktop and mobile platforms with competitive transaction spreads of 0.10% ($10/trade minimum). The platform now includes investment-grade and high-yield corporate bonds, reinforcing Webull's commitment to diversified portfolio options and cost-effective access for U.S. customers.

feed.title: Webull Launches Corporate Bond Trading, Expanding its Fixed Income Investment Options - PR Newswire
feed.summary: Webull has launched corporate bond trading for U.S. customers, allowing them to buy and sell individual corporate bonds on its desktop and mobile platforms. This expands on their existing fixed income offerings, including U.S. government bonds and fractional bond trading, with a competitive transaction spread of 0.10% (minimum $10/trade). The new offering includes investment-grade and high-yield corporate bonds, all denominated in U.S. dollars and rated by S&P.

feed.title: 0.10% transaction spreads — Webull launches corporate bond trading for U.S. investors with $10 minimum - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Webull launched corporate bond trading for U.S. investors on October 16, 2025, offering individual corporate bonds with a 0.10% transaction spread and a $10 minimum. This expansion includes investment-grade and high-yield bonds, all S&P rated and denominated in U.S. dollars, building on Webull's earlier introduction of U.S. Treasuries and fractional bond trading. The initiative aims to provide retail investors with low-cost access to the corporate fixed income market.
